text: Bob Lenz is an American educational activist, known as the CEO of PBL Works (formerly Buck Institute of education). == Early life and education == He received his Bachelor's degree from St. Mary's College in 1986 and Masters in Education from San Francisco State University in 1991. == Career == In 1993, Bob started his career as a teacher at Sir Francis Drake High School and founded a leadership and humanities program called Academy X in 1999. The program received recognition and was showcased on the front cover of U.S. News & World Report in 2000. In 2001, Bob helped start Envision Education, where he was the CEO and head of innovation. This organization worked to improve education for students in cities. On June 1, 2015, Bob Lenz became the CEO of PBLWorks. PBL Works promotes Project-Based Learning, where students learn by doing real-world projects. Bob Lenz is known for high school redesign, teaching through projects and teaching skills for the future. He received recognition as a Senior Deeper Learning Fellow from the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation. He also wrote a book called "Transforming Schools: Using Project-Based Learning, Performance Assessment, and Common Core Standards". == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:American teachers Category:American company founders
